action.action-desc: Mr. Amodei (for himself, Mr. Gosar, Mr. McClintock, Mr. Pittenger, Mr. Franks of Arizona, and Mr. Huizenga) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide an exemption to the individual mandate to maintain health coverage for individuals residing in counties with fewer than 2 health insurance issuers offering plans on an Exchange.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protection from Insurance Exchange Monopolies Act.

section.header: Modifications to exemption from requirement to maintain health coverage

subsection.header: Exemption for individuals in areas with fewer than 2 issuers offering plans on an Exchange
subsection.text: Section 5000A(e) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Individuals in areas with fewer than 2 issuers offering plans on an Exchange

subparagraph.text: Any applicable individual for any period during a calendar year if there are fewer than 2 health insurance issuers offering qualified health plans on an Exchange for such period in the county in which the applicable individual resides.

For purposes of subparagraph (A), all health insurance issuers treated as a single employer under subsection (a) or (b) of section 52, or subsection (m) or (o) of section 414, shall be treated as a single health insurance issuer.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to months beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
